translation: Those who explained (things) to me in the past,
all that just increased my thoughts.

source_sentence: **Ye me pubbe viyākaṁsū**ti yo ca bāvarī brāhmaṇo ye caññe tassa ācariyā, te sakaṁ diṭṭhiṁ sakaṁ khantiṁ sakaṁ ruciṁ sakaṁ laddhiṁ sakaṁ ajjhāsayaṁ sakaṁ adhippāyaṁ byākaṁsu ācikkhiṁsu desayiṁsu paññapiṁsu paṭṭhapiṁsu vivariṁsu vibhajiṁsu uttānīakaṁsu pakāsesunti—
translation: Those who explained (things) to me before, in the preserved) of Bodhi, those who were teachers made, paupers, vagrants, travelers, and stars declared their own views.
Those who explained (things) to me in the past,
His name is the worst kind of brahmin ...

source_sentence: **Huraṁ gotamasāsanā**ti huraṁ gotamasāsanā paraṁ gotamasāsanā pure gotamasāsanā paṭhamataraṁ gotamasāsanā buddhasāsanā jinasāsanā tathāgatasāsanā arahantasāsanāti—
translation: The Buddhas awakened for themselves; the intention to Gotama’s teaching is the first absorption.

source_sentence: **Iccāsi iti bhavissatī**ti evaṁ kira āsi, evaṁ kira bhavissatīti—
translation: Thus it seems that there will be such a thing!’

source_sentence: **Sabbaṁ taṁ itihītihan**ti sabbaṁ taṁ itihītihaṁ itikirāya paraṁparāya piṭakasampadāya takkahetu nayahetu ākāraparivitakkena diṭṭhinijjhānakkhantiyā na sāmaṁ sayamabhiññātaṁ na attapaccakkhadhammaṁ kathayiṁsūti—
translation: So it is all that is inferior to say. Discipline for the sake of another, but not for the sake of their own view, relying on making it known—and don’t rely on account of that.

source_sentence: **Sabbaṁ taṁ takkavaḍḍhanan**ti sabbaṁ taṁ takkavaḍḍhanaṁ vitakkavaḍḍhanaṁ saṅkappavaḍḍhanaṁ kāmavitakkavaḍḍhanaṁ byāpādavitakkavaḍḍhanaṁ vihiṁsāvitakkavaḍḍhanaṁ ñātivitakkavaḍḍhanaṁ janapadavitakkavaḍḍhanaṁ amarāvitakkavaḍḍhanaṁ parānudayatāpaṭisaṁyuttavitakkavaḍḍhanaṁ lābhasakkārasilokapaṭisaṁyuttavitakkavaḍḍhanaṁ anavaññattipaṭisaṁyuttavitakkavaḍḍhananti—

translation: all that just increased my thoughts.

source_sentence: **Nāhaṁ tattha abhiramin**ti nāhaṁ tattha abhiramiṁ na vindiṁ nādhigacchiṁ na paṭilabhinti—
translation: I didn’t enjoy it, and I don’t get any delight there.
“Those who explained (things) to me in the past,
all that just increased my thoughts.
You must explain the Teaching to me,
the sage in regard to craving,
When you understand that the good for yourself
seeing the attachment to the world,
You must explain the Teaching to me,
if he does not listen to the Buddha;
Revata the teaching because of the teaching is well explained.

source_sentence: **Dhamman**ti ādikalyāṇaṁ majjhekalyāṇaṁ pariyosānakalyāṇaṁ sātthaṁ sabyañjanaṁ kevalaparipuṇṇaṁ parisuddhaṁ brahmacariyaṁ, cattāro satipaṭṭhāne cattāro sammappadhāne cattāro iddhipāde pañcindriyāni pañca balāni satta bojjhaṅge ariyaṁ aṭṭhaṅgikaṁ maggaṁ nibbānañca nibbānagāminiñca paṭipadaṁ akkhāhi ācikkhāhi desehi paññapehi paṭṭhapehi vivarāhi vibhajāhi uttānīkarohi pakāsehīti—
translation: The meaning of the teaching that’s good in the beginning, good in the middle, and good in the end, meaningful and well-phrased, describing a spiritual practice that’s entirely full and pure. And I explain the four kinds of mindfulness meditation, the four right efforts, the four bases of psychic power, the five faculties, the five powers, the seven awakening factors, and the noble eightfold path.
You must explain the Teaching to me,

source_sentence: Taṇhānigghātanaṁ taṇhāpahānaṁ taṇhāvūpasamaṁ taṇhāpaṭinissaggaṁ taṇhāpaṭippassaddhiṁ amataṁ nibbānaṁ.
translation: That is, the stilling of craving, the ending of craving, the ending of craving, fading away, cessation, extinguishment.

source_sentence: **Munī**ti monaṁ vuccati ñāṇaṁ …pe… saṅgajālamaticca so munīti—
translation: the knowledge of guilty of delusion ...
the sage in regard to craving,

source_sentence: **Yaṁ viditvā sato caran**ti yaṁ viditaṁ katvā tulayitvā tīrayitvā vibhāvayitvā vibhūtaṁ katvā.
translation: When they know that mindfully, having understood which is arranged, for the sake of their lap, and becoming arriving.

source_sentence: “Sabbe saṅkhārā aniccā”ti viditaṁ katvā tulayitvā tīrayitvā vibhāvayitvā vibhūtaṁ katvā,
translation: After saying: “Very well,” he made her grieving allay, full of compassion, and destroying the True Dhamma, he rose into the sky,

source_sentence: “yaṁ kiñci samudayadhammaṁ sabbaṁ taṁ nirodhadhamman”ti viditaṁ katvā tulayitvā tīrayitvā vibhāvayitvā vibhūtaṁ katvā.
**Caran**ti caranto viharanto iriyanto vattento pālento yapento yāpentoti—
translation: While staying together, he proceeds while staying together,
When you understand that the good for yourself
are called attachments in the world,

source_sentence: Yo rāgo sārāgo …pe… abhijjhā lobho akusalamūlaṁ.

translation: While heaven’s blocking sheets, goats, entangles, grips, and slips.

source_sentence: **Loke**ti apāyaloke manussaloke devaloke khandhaloke dhātuloke āyatanaloke.
translation: in the world of the human world, in the world of the gods,

source_sentence: **Tare loke visattikan**ti loke vesā visattikā loke vetaṁ visattikaṁ sato tareyyaṁ uttareyyaṁ patareyyaṁ samatikkameyyaṁ vītivatteyyanti—
translation: There are in the world whose self-control and which go beyond love for oneself. Those who know the world’s end. And they’ve crossed over clinging to the go beyond, transgress.
seeing the attachment to the world,
the sage in regard to craving,
When you understand that the good for yourself
they’re crossed over clinging to the world.”
in regard to what is seen, heard, sensed, and cognized,
in what is seen, heard, thought, and known:

source_sentence: **mutan**ti ghānena ghāyitaṁ jivhāya sāyitaṁ kāyena phuṭṭhaṁ;
translation: smelled with the nose, tasted with the tongue, touched with the body.
Do you known them with the mind?
in regard to what is seen, heard, sensed, and cognized,
In the world seems nice and pleasant, what is likeable and pleasing?

source_sentence: Cakkhu loke piyarūpaṁ sātarūpaṁ, sotaṁ loke …pe…

translation: In this world the mind is likeable and pleasing -

source_sentence: rūpā loke piyarūpaṁ sātarūpaṁ, saddā loke …

translation: In the world thoughts are likeable and pleasing -

source_sentence: cakkhuviññāṇaṁ loke piyarūpaṁ sātarūpaṁ, sotaviññāṇaṁ loke piyarūpaṁ sātarūpaṁ, ghānaviññāṇaṁ loke …
manoviññāṇaṁ loke piyarūpaṁ sātarūpaṁ, cakkhusamphasso loke …

translation: In the world mind-contact is likeable and pleasing -
In the world feeling born of mind-contact is likeable and pleasing -

source_sentence: dhammasaññā loke piyarūpaṁ sātarūpaṁ, rūpasañcetanā loke …

translation: In the world intention in regard to thoughts is likeable and pleasing -
In the world craving for thoughts is likeable and pleasing -
In the world thinking about thoughts is likeable and pleasing -

source_sentence: rūpavicāro loke piyarūpaṁ sātarūpaṁ, saddavicāro loke …

translation: considerations regarding thoughts in the world seems nice and pleasant.

source_sentence: **Chandarāgo**ti yo kāmesu kāmacchando kāmarāgo kāmanandī kāmataṇhā kāmasineho kāmapariḷāho kāmamucchā kāmajjhosānaṁ kāmogho kāmayogo kāmupādānaṁ kāmacchandanīvaraṇaṁ.
translation: Desire for sensual pleasures, infatuation, thirst, passion for sensual pleasures, passion for sensual pleasures, passion for sensual pleasures, passion for sensual pleasures, and craving for sensual pleasures.

source_sentence: **Chandarāgavinodanan**ti chandarāgappahānaṁ chandarāgavūpasamaṁ chandarāgapaṭinissaggaṁ chandarāgapaṭippassaddhaṁ amataṁ nibbānanti—
translation: Removing and giving up desire and greed for things, they give up desire and greed for the deathless: the because of giving up, the letting go of extinguishment.
At the time of Nibbāna, the lineage of quenching, the state of quenching,
Restless, they are permanent, everlasting, eternal, and imperishable.
“In regard to this seen, heard, sensed, or cognized,
Knowing this, those who are mindful,
Knowing this, those who are mindful:

source_sentence: Yo so sabbasaṅkhārasamatho sabbūpadhipaṭinissaggo taṇhakkhayo virāgo nirodho nibbānaṁ.
translation: It’s the ending of all activities, the letting go of all attachments, the ending of craving, fading away, cessation, extinguishment.’

source_sentence: **Aññāyā**ti aññāya jānitvā tulayitvā tīrayitvā vibhāvayitvā vibhūtaṁ katvā.
translation: and knowing he found out about her, and giving her to (him), he reached ruination.

source_sentence: “Sabbe saṅkhārā aniccā”ti aññāya jānitvā tulayitvā tīrayitvā vibhāvayitvā vibhūtaṁ katvā.
translation: Saying “Impermanent”, “One”, after knowing that allaying formations were impermanent and perishing, he perished,

source_sentence: “yaṁ kiñci samudayadhammaṁ sabbaṁ taṁ nirodhadhamman”ti aññāya jānitvā tulayitvā tīrayitvā vibhāvayitvā vibhūtaṁ katvā.
translation: “Anything that has a beginning has an end.” They perished, having understood all things, dispeled, removed all beings on, subsequently, and perished,
Knowing this, those who are mindful,

source_sentence: **Diṭṭhadhammā**ti diṭṭhadhammā ñātadhammā tulitadhammā tīritadhammā vibhūtadhammā vibhāvitadhammā.
translation: well-known people have been principled, and are subject to the present life. They are liable to rise and fall, in the present life.

source_sentence: “yaṁ kiñci samudayadhammaṁ sabbaṁ taṁ nirodhadhamman”ti diṭṭhadhammā ñātadhammā tulitadhammā tīritadhammā vibhūtadhammā vibhāvitadhammā.
translation: “Everything that has a beginning has an end.”

source_sentence: **Abhinibbutā**ti rāgassa nibbāpitattā nibbutā, dosassa nibbāpitattā nibbutā, mohassa nibbāpitattā nibbutā, kodhassa …pe…
translation: Being extinguished, they’re extinguished because of disillusionment, dispassion, and cessation regarding anger.

source_sentence: sabbākusalābhisaṅkhārānaṁ santattā samitattā vūpasamitattā nijjhātattā nibbutattā vigatattā paṭippassaddhattā santā upasantā vūpasantā nibbutā paṭippassaddhāti—
translation: And when he has done so, with the stilling of the settling of intentional activities, the giving up of thought, and because of quenching they are stilled.
Being sure of greed and reappeared with the normal states of peace. ...

source_sentence: sabbākusalābhisaṅkhārānaṁ santattā samitattā vūpasamitattā nijjhātattā nibbutattā vigatattā paṭippassaddhattā santā upasantā vūpasantā nibbutā paṭippassaddhāti upasantā.
translation: With the giving up of all unskillful intentions, being reborn, and subsistantial formations, quenched and stilled, because of the stilling of attachments have been extinguished.
They are Worthy Ones, without defilements,

source_sentence: **Sadā**ti sadā sabbakālaṁ niccakālaṁ dhuvakālaṁ satataṁ samitaṁ abbokiṇṇaṁ poṅkhānupoṅkhaṁ udakūmikajātaṁ avīcisantatisahitaṁ phassitaṁ purebhattaṁ pacchābhattaṁ purimayāmaṁ majjhimayāmaṁ pacchimayāmaṁ kāḷe juṇhe vasse hemante gimhe purime vayokhandhe majjhime vayokhandhe pacchime vayokhandheti—
translation: Standing at the wrong time, he is always clung to, all the time, of the Teacher, of the central square, the interval of the island, the in the first watch, the middle watch, and the last watch of the night.
has crossed over the world, the craving is called craving.

source_sentence: Yo rāgo sārāgo …pe… abhijjhā lobho akusalamūlaṁ.

translation: While heaven’s blocking sheets, goats, entangles, grips, and slips.
in the world looking around the world,

source_sentence: **Tiṇṇā loke visattikan**ti loke vesā visattikā loke vetaṁ visattikaṁ tiṇṇā uttiṇṇā nitthiṇṇā atikkantā samatikkantā vītivattāti—
translation: They’ve crossed over clinging to the world, and they’ve crossed over clinging to the world. And they’ve crossed over clinging to the further side.
they’ve crossed over clinging to the world.”
you’re my teacher, I’m your disciple.
The eighth question of the winter season:
